summary: Jon Snow is as beautiful as ever in the trailer. Of course he looks solemn - he has the weight of the world on his shoulders....
body:
Jon Snow is as beautiful as ever in the trailer. Of course he looks solemn - he has the weight of the world on his shoulders. His remarkable courage is matched by his compassion. He cares about everything and everyone. Give the man a goddamn break for not smiling during the zombie apocalypse.

Oh and also? He looks majestic a.f. riding amid the soldiers. I mean, it’s all subjective, but I couldn’t disagree more with those saying that he and Daenerys don’t look regal in that scene. I’m biased of course, but he looks every bit a king. And c’mon, you don’t have to be a Dany stan to see that she’s looked like a Queen since day one.

I’m biased of course, but he looks every bit a king. And c’mon, you don’t have to be a Dany stan to see that she’s looked like a Queen since day one.

I’m biased of course, but he looks every bit a king. And c’mon, you don’t have to be a Dany stan to see that she’s looked like a Queen since day one.

tags: gosh my inbox is such a sigh rn
summary: Sansa loves Jon. She has never and will never think of him as only anything. Especially half brother. You do know they are not...
question: Sansa loves Jon. She has never and will never think of him as only anything. Especially half brother. You do know they are not really siblings but cousins? How dare you make up such shitty lies about Sansa.
answer:
Sansa would beg to differ.

“He’s our brother,” Arya said, much too loudly. Her voice cut through the afternoon quiet of the tower room.          
Septa Mordane raised her eyes. She had a bony face, sharp eyes, and a thin lipless mouth made for frowning. It was frowning now. “What are you talking about, children?”
“Our half brother,” Sansa corrected, soft and precise.

She had not thought of Jon in ages. He was only her half brother, but still … with Robb and Bran and Rickon dead, Jon Snow was the only brother that remained to her.

Sansa literally corrects Arya when Arya says that Jon is their brother. Her thoughts of Jon always include the differentiation of him being her half brother or bastard brother.

“There was a black brother,” Sansa said, “begging men for the Wall, only he was kind of old and smelly.” She hadn’t liked that at all. She had always imagined the Night’s Watch to be men like Uncle Benjen. In the songs, they were called the black knights of the Wall. But this man had been crookbacked and hideous, and he looked as though he might have lice. If this was what the Night’s Watch was truly like, she felt sorry for her bastard half brother, Jon.

She sang for mercy, for the living and the dead alike, for Bran and Rickon and Robb, for her sister Arya and her bastard brother Jon Snow, away off on the Wall.

Sansa could never understand how two sisters, born only two years apart, could be so different. It would have been easier if Arya had been a bastard, like their half brother Jon. She even looked like Jon, with the long face and brown hair of the Starks, and nothing of their lady mother in her face or her coloring. And Jon’s mother had been common, or so people whispered. Once, when she was littler, Sansa had even asked Mother if perhaps there hadn’t been some mistake. Perhaps the grumkins had stolen her real sister. But Mother had only laughed and said no, Arya was her daughter and Sansa’s trueborn sister, blood of their blood. Sansa could not think why Mother would want to lie about it, so she supposed it had to be true.

Note the assertion here that Arya was Sansa’s trueborn sister, blood of their blood. It implies that there is a difference in proximity between a trueborn sibling and a bastard sibling. Sansa goes on to think that it would be easier if Arya was a bastrad like Jon because of that exact sentiment since it is expected for there to be a distance between trueborn and bastard siblings.

Also, Sansa does not know that Jon is her cousin so that has no bearing on how she refers to him, hence the half brother part. That does not mean that I think that Sansa hates Jon or any such nonsense, only that she sees him in a different way from how she sees the rest of her siblings, specifically because he is a bastard.

In short, please do reread the books before you go off in people’s inbox about their so-called lies. Or, if you’re a show-only watcher, perhaps rewatch the scene where Sansa says that she was horrible to Jon as a child and asks him to forgive her.

summary: I find it quite telling that Missandei and Grey Worm get to share a two second kiss in the two minute trailer while Jon and Dany...
body: I find it quite telling that Missandei and Grey Worm get to share a two second kiss in the two minute trailer while Jon and Dany only get tense/ broody moments. Yes, everyone has been shipping Missandei and Grey Worm for years, but one would think the “big couple” of the show, the saviours who were promised, would at least get one kiss or one romantic moment to really drive the “romance” in, given that they are now an open couple.

blog.name: lilmilme
blog.title: In love with ancient gods and fallen empires.
blog.description: Welcome to my castle, filled with love and suffering. Writing. Musing. Anticipating. Hobby English Speaker. German Major. Defier of Canon. GoT. The 100. I’ll die mad over GoT but Jon Snow is still my man. Here for the drama.

title: Quick thoughts
body:
(Btw, for some reason whenever anything GoT related drops I’m sitting in a lecture, completely oblivious. Always.)

- I think it’s really interesting that we can’t tell from the trailer what D*ny, her dragons and the Dothraki are up to while the rest fight against the dead. Especially, since thanks to 7x06 we already have visuals of the dragons burning up wights and - judging the reaction videos to that episode and 7x04 - people looove seeing the dragons blow up sh*t, so it would have made for good trailer content while not spoiling anything. Instead we have them flying around in daylight and sitting on a bunch of bones. Yeah.

- Whatever D*any does, we DO know that Jorah and Grey Worm and the Unsullied stay and fight for the living. On rewatch, they really drove home that the Unsullied and Jorah are fighting the dead which makes me think it’s meant to deflect from D*ny’s absence. They’ve been so loyal to her for so long, surely if they are there, she’s there, too; they just don’t want to spoil her epic scenes against the NK, right? RIGHT?!

- I never thought of it before but this trailer made me realize how much I want to see Grey Worm take control over the Unsullied and GW & Missandei finally becoming their own people. Hasn’t this been their theme all along? Even though the Queen They Chose abandons the fight, they stay behind, to do what is right, although it may cost them everything. A lot of people think that either GW or M will die. I think that quite likely, too. But wouldn’t it be poetically even sadder if they not died because they were following commands but because of their own free will - for the living - when they could have easily followed D*ny south and survived?

- I have been rooting for Jorah to get home for half a decade now and I don’t mean this geographically. I think he finally will which unfortunately also raises the likeliness of his death (although he always had bad cards; I always assumed he’d either die for D*ny or by D*ny).

- About the scene with D*ny and Jon in the crypts … I’m not sure if they would go there but if they actually have Jon say You don’t belong down here like he did to Littlefinger, my jaw will be on the floor. Some people say this scene takes place shortly after their arrival in WF - in that case I’d think it impossible for him to say this to her but if it happens after the parentage reveal (to Jon, not D*ny) then I can actually see him snap like that(followed by instant internal regret, as it’s neither smart nor nice).

- This is going to be a tough season for D*ny and while I don’t want to see her on any throne (because I don’t think she can rule at all and if she couldn’t learn it in 7 seasons she won’t learn it now) I will feel sorry for her, truly - not for the Mother of Dragons though but for the sunburnt girl in a pale pink dress, standing on Illyrio’s balcony, looking across the narrow sea and dreaming of home.

- My certainty for the kidnapping plot to happen just skyrocketed and I actually think that the pictures rumored to be Jon bending the knee to Cersei are exactly that.

- I have yet to see anything that contradicts Jon x Sansa which is quite telling considering the amount of J*nerys they’ve been dropping but that might be just me.

Anyways, I’m so hyped and so ready for this!
body_abstract:
(Btw, for some reason whenever anything GoT related drops I’m sitting in a lecture, completely oblivious. Always.)

- I think it’s really interesting that we can’t tell from the trailer what D*ny, her dragons and the Dothraki are up to while the rest fight against the dead. Especially, since thanks to 7x06 we already have visuals of the dragons burning up wights and - judging the reaction videos to that episode and 7x04 - people looove seeing the dragons blow up sh*t, so it would have made for good trailer content while not spoiling anything. Instead we have them flying around in daylight and sitting on a bunch of bones. Yeah.

- Whatever D*any does, we DO know that Jorah and Grey Worm and the Unsullied stay and fight for the living. On rewatch, they really drove home that the Unsullied and Jorah are fighting the dead which makes me think it’s meant to deflect from D*ny’s absence. They’ve been so loyal to her for so long, surely if they are there, she’s there, too; they just don’t want to spoil her epic scenes against the NK, right? RIGHT?!
